column1: pitched on a length, thick inside edge to the onside. Solid start
another length delivery, just under 141kph, Rohit defends to mid-on
wider of off stump this time, dead-batted
fuller on middle stump, almost squared Rohit up. Batsman manages to drive it down to mid-on again
shorter delivery, batsman gets behind it nicely to block. Good first over so far from Cummins
some movement around off stump, thick outside edge through the covers. The first over is a maiden
exquisite drive from Dhawan, the ball races back down the field to the boundary. Full and straight, and Dhawan simply timed it straight back down the ground
shorter from Starc, fended to the leg side
full and straight again, this time Dhawan defends it to mid-on
hits Dhawan on the pads. The ball was going down the legside, though
wild lash outside off stump from Dhawan, lucky to miss it. Worst delivery of the day so far, arguably, well outside off. Dhawan wanted to smash it through the covers
runs it down to fine leg. Five from Starc's first over
driven on the up to mid-off
a bit of width, and Dhawan latches on to it in a flash. Pinged past a diving cover-point fielder all the way. When you give Dhawan a chance to free his arms, you'd best be prepared for what follows
short of a length, leaves this one alone
leg stump line this time, and flicked down to fine leg. Dhawan is looking dialled in right from the start
slightly uppish, but in the gap and races to the square leg boundary. Ordinary delivery, really, dragged down the leg side. Rohit just needed to get some bat on it
goes shorter this time, Rohit tries to beat fine leg, who's in the circle, but the ball goes straight to him. Another excellent over for India
targets top of off, fended to backward point
full toss wide outside off stump. Batsman didn't quite time it
cut away to the third man boundary, where Cummins did especially well to ensure it didn't go for four
nearly went through the gap between bat and pad. Length delivery, inside edge on to the pad. Dhawan was momentarily unsure where that ball was going
well, that's just meat and drink for Dhawan. 146kph, full, dragged down the leg side. Dhawan needs only to use the pace and he sends it barrelling past fine leg for four.
defended
oooh, Rohit misjudged the line there. Wanted to get on to the back foot to pull, ball goes underneath the bat
worked away to square leg. Cummins getting back to that wicket-to-wicket line that earned him that maiden over
too close to cut, play and a miss from Dhawan. This is the line Cummins needs to consistently bowl to the left-hander
and again. Dhawan looking for room to open up the offside. Thick bottom edge
fuller, nearly got the outside edge. Dhawan poked at it, no feet movement to accompany the hands. Fortunate to be beaten
quick run to mid-on prompts the fielder to have a shy. Direct hit, but the ball deflects away to allow the batsmen to run another one. Nevertheless, excellent over from Cummins again
back of a length, driven back to the bowler
drags this one down the legside
gorgeous. Full on off stump, and Rohit leans into the drive, and the cover fielders don't even move. There would be no point.
driven to cover
works it past a diving backward point, who got a hand to it. It's technically a dropped catch, but blaming the fielder for it would be harsh in the extreme
cramps him for room
pulled away in front of midwicket. Absolutely no timing, but there's enough of a gap there for the batsmen to come back for two
guided down to fine leg
slower delivery outside off stump, Rohit tries to run it through to the third man boundary. The fielder in the circle cuts it off
just outside off, left wel alone
straighter line to Dhawan
runs down the track, Richardson reads this and pulls his line back, forcing the batsman to fend it down to the legside
beats short fine leg this time. Brilliant wristwork to work the ball from off stump down to the fine leg boundary,a nd once it went past the fielder, there was no stopping it
driven on the up to mid-off
length delivery, timed to cover
another expansive drive, gets a thick outside edge and goes down to third man
defended
worked to the onside, Good running

too easy fro Dhawan. Cummins goes down the legside again, and Dhawan just needs to flick it down to fine leg. The fielder isn't even at the boundary, but I suspect that might not have made a difference
back foot punch, straight to a fielder though

this one beats the cover fielders though. Rocks back and crunches it through the offside. Cover point thought about giving it a chase, turned around and saw the ball racing away and stopped dead in his tracks.
guided through the onside, and the pair change ends. The 50-partnership comes up
bit of hesitation, and had Richardson stopped the ball, a run-out was on.
takes the pace off the ball. We might see more of that given how flat this wicket looks right now
and again. Rohit works it away to square leg and keeps the strike
runs it down to midwicket
short delivery, and it cracks Dhawan in the ribs. Enough presence of mind to take a single, but he will need treatment. He has gone down
bit of bounce here. Struck Rohit high on the bat, nearly got him on the gloves
wicket-to-wicket, blocked
another one targeting the stumps. Near-perfect over from Cummins. All it needs, from an Aussie point of view, is a wicket
flicked off the pads for one. 55 in 10 for India, and Peter will take you through the next 10
short on the stumps, imperious pull from Rohit over midwicket, lands just short of the rope but well wide of the fielder on the rope and it's relayed in for a long two.
length ball on fourth stump, guided off the open face to deep third man.
short on fourth stump, uppercut/ramps this gently over the ring to deep third man.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched off the back foot straight to extra cover.
fullish length on off stump, pushed firmly out to the cover sweeper.
short on middle at 143 kph, sat up to swivel a pull without any fuss behind square, beats the boundary rider with ease.
floated too full down leg, Rohit goes to sweep but it's too full for the shot and misses leg stump comfortably. Rebowl coming.
straighter this time on about the same full length, defended to midwicket.
fullish length on fourth stump, Rohit reaches out in front of his body to prod this toward extra cover, misfield allows a run.
charges a full ball on off stump and hammers a straight drive, intercepted by Australia's anthropomorphic 12th man, the non-striker's stumps.
fuller and flatter on fourth stump, goes back to poke this to point for a run.
good length ball, defended.
full on the legs, clipped behind square to keep strike for the next over.
short on sixth stump, guided with an open face to deep third man.
slower ball on the legs, misses a paddle pull off the hips and the ball caroms to short fine leg.
short on about seventh stump, Rohit uses his stretch Armstrong arms to whack a flat-bat tennis racquet pull through wide mid-on. The crowd begins chanting, 'Ro-Hit! Ro-Hit!'
good length ball on the legs, tickled through square leg to get off strike.
fullish length on the legs, goes back and across to flick behind square, held to one.
good length ball on the stumps, tries to guide this to deep third man but cramped for room and picks out backward point.
full on the stumps, driven firmly to long-off.
floated on a fullish length on fifth stump, Rohit uses his lengthy reach once again to slog sweep this flat over cow corner, one bounce over the rope.

so classy for so much of this first hour, Rohit looks very clumsy falling over to this missed sweep and is given lbw. But he's gone for the review! And it's frankly a terrible review. He clearly lost his bearings falling off balance losing any sense of where he was in front of the stumps. Missed this full ball and was struck halfway up the shin. The ball was ripping out middle and off stump 3/4 of the way up. Shikhar should be equally at fault on the wasted review for not talking him out of it if he's got a good view at the non-striker's end.
full on fifth stump, driven crisply to the cover sweeper to get off the mark.
fullish length on middle, whipped along the ground straight to midwicket.
slightly shorter on leg stump, goes back to flick straight to midwicket again.
short and wide outside off, goes to cut, beaten for pace.
short on fifth stump, shuffles across in defense.
silky! Like buttah! In the slot in fifth stump, firm press, hardly a flourish, all timing in the gap between extra cover and mid-off. Yum.
good length ball on off stump, shuffles back and across to flick this through midwicket.
bouncer on the stumps, ducks under it with ease.
fullish length ball on the stumps, defended to cover.
good length ball on fifth stump, goes back to gently tap to extra cover.

fuller length this time on the same line, encourages a crisp drive past extra cover, sweeper does well sliding at the rope to keep it to two, Labuschagne. Or did he? Some doubt about his back heel possibly clipping the boundary padding. Trick photography with the shadows. It's ruled two.
full on off, driven through more directly to the cover sweeper.
flighted more on the legs, goes back to whip this to deep midwicket.
full on the stumps, whipped wristily through to long-on.
good length on the stumps, goes back to flick through midwicket.
full on the stumps, flicked wide of mid-on.
bouncer on the stumps, climbs sharply as Kohli tucks under a hook, climbs sharply and beats Carey's leap. Given four byes instead of five wides. Hmm....
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
short and wide, cut to deep third man.
full on the stumps, driven firmly but straight to mid-off.
short on the stumps, sways back to get inside the line as it goes through to Carey at head height.
flights this loads, but can't get it to pitch, shin high full toss on fourth stump driven firmly to long-off.
fuller on off stump, goes deep on his crease to tip and run behind point.
quicker and flatter on middle stump at 95 kph, lands too short though and Kohli pumps a pull behind square. Zampa with hands on head as it races to the backward square rope.
flighted more on off at 90 kph, driven to the cover sweeper.
uses his feet to drive a full ball from off stump to long-off.
flighted full on middle at 90 kph, defended with a big stride forward back to Zampa.
good length ball on off, defended.
fuller on fifth stump, caresses this drive through the covers, beats the sweeper with ease to the rope.
drives another full ball a bit more softly to Labuschagne sweeping on the cover rope.
drifts this one the legs, tickled fine past Carey and they hustle a sharp two.
full on fourth stump, driven comfortably to long-off.
bowls this shorter straying on the legs, goes back to flick behind square to keep strike for the 20th.
full on off stump at 85 kph, reaches forward with a firm press to long-off.
flatter and wider on sixth stump at 96 kph, cuts this but straight to backward point.
shorter and straying on the legs, goes back to flick behind square.
flicked down to the onside
driven down the ground
tickled to fine leg
driven down to long-on
runs down the wicket, but Agar rushes the ball through. Dhawan has to adjust and rives it back to the bowler
blocked
worked to the onside. Thought about a run, but the onrushing fielder made him reconsider
that's another way to get a single. Goes over the top, clears mid-on, and the ball goes on the bounce to long-on
keeps the strike after prodding this one to the leg side
begins with one around the ribcage, nurdled down to fine leg
and that's a half-century for Dhawan! Two in as many ODIs. His 29th half-century. The previous game will remind him he needs more than that
crunched to extra cover, the timing not there to find a gap
persists with the leg stump line to Kohli. Too easy for him to nudge it to fine leg once more
flashes, flashes hard, flashes hard enough the edge beats a leaping wicketkeeper! Races away for four. Decent delivery from Starc, deserved a better outcome
sends this down the legside, and Dhawan helps it on to fine leg. Good over for India again
darts it through, Dhawan works it away to the on side
back foot punch to long-off. Agar isn't offering much flight
tickled to short fine
rushes this one even quicker, Kohli content to send it back down the ground for one
slight turn beats the inside edge of the bat
cruise control for India right now. Another leg side single
Dhawan wanted to lift this over square leg. thick inside edge onto the pad, and the pair scramble a single instead
back of a length, Kohli quick with his footwork and punches it down to midwicket for one
seems a concerted plan to frustrate Dhawan down the onside. He tried to help this one aerially over fine leg, too. Something to watch out for
dragged back, driven to mid-off
bouncer. Seemed a bit high, but Starc gets away with it
finally middles that pick-up shot. Labuschagne had a bit of sharp work to do at deep midwicket, and keeps it down to two.
cramps him for room, Dhawan blocks
bit of air given to the ball, Kohli whacks it back to the bowler. On the bounce, mind you. Relax
and again, straight back to Agar
more flight, slight turn, opens the face of the bat
lifts it over midwicket, exquisite sweep shot. Not much wrong with the delivery, really, but Dhawan's timing and placement is superb
and now the reverse sweep comes out! Helps it beat the third man fielder. Dhawan's moving up gears!
keeps the strike. 10 from the over
disdainfully sliced to the backward point boundary. Dhawan on fire isn't the best time to be asked to come on. Especially if you're a part-timer
uppish, nearly a caught-and-bowled. Chipped it over the bowler's head, no timing. Had Marnus been three inches taller, Dhawan would be gone
eased to deep midwicket
dragged down, fortunate Dhawan found the on side boundary rider instead of a gap
block and run
pushes Dhawan onto the back foot. Muffled appeal; the bowler seemed to believe it had brushed Dhawan's pad. Nothing doing, though
opens the bat face to short third. Good running again
runs down the ground, nearly yorks himself, though. Rare dot delivery
that's enormous. Dances down the track and absolutely thwacks this into the stand behind cow corner. The sweetness of the timing on that!
and the poor ball comes. Down the onside, and Dhawan helps it to the fine leg boundary. This may well be Agar's last over
strikes him on the pad. Slight appeal from Agar
and Dhawan keeps the strike. 12 from this over. Are India finally moving up a gear?
smart bowling. Dhawan gave it away early by coming down the wicket, Labuschagne drags it down
straight back to the bowler
bit more flight. Slightly uppish on its way to midwciket
another drag down, but Dhawan again only finds the boundary fielder
Kohli eases it back down to long-on. Very content to just hand Dhawan back the strike for now
ruins the over for Australia. Just outside leg stump, and Dhawan helps it on with a cross batted thump. Beats fine leg. 6 from that one
backfoot punch through the covers. The sweeper on the boundary has a chase on, and keeps it to two
slower ball, Kohli reads it early, and works it away to the on-side. Partnership is 99 now
the hundred partnership comes up! And how! Sees the slower ball early, rocks back, waits for it, and deposits it back over Richardson's head for four

what just happened there! Dhawan has holed out for 96! It was under the armpit, the line Australia have targeted for so long. Dhawan used the pace, timed it perfectly, but saw it carry straight to the fielder at fine leg. Tremendous innings, but doesn't get him to three figures
welcomes him to the crease with a bouncer. Iyer is an interesting move, though
short of a length. 7 runs and a wicket from the 29th
crunched through the offside
almost carried back to Adam Zampa. The bowler realised late how uppish it was, but Iyer's had a major fright first up
blocked
gets off the mar with a quick single on the offside
flicked to the onside. Flatter to Kohli
flight, and driven to extra cover. Just 2 off that Zampa over, and here's Peter to take you through the next 10
back of a length on off stump, guided to deep third man.
full on off stump, driven hard through the covers, sweeper has to cover 20 yards before sliding at the rope so it's an easy two.
bouncer on fifth stump, sways back to get under it with ease.
short outside off at 131 kph, sits up for him to tennis racquet swat it past midwicket in the ring through wide long-on.
bouncer on the stumps this time at 133 kph, aborts a hook at lets it pass.
cutter at 122 kph on off stump, keeps the hands back to play it softly but can't glide it wide enough of backward point to make room for a run.
full pitching outside leg, clipped behind square.
fullish length on fourth stump, pushed to extra cover.
good length on fourth stump, guided to deep third man.
short on fourth stump, fended to backward point.
pitched fuller on fourth stump, driven firmly to extra cover.
good length but plenty of width on about seventh stump, chops a cut off a bottom edge into the ground and cut off at backward point.
flighted full on off, driven hard back to Zampa at head height, oohs from the crowd as he spills it but it was a bump ball, misfield caroms wide of mid-off for a run.
full and wide, driven to backward point.
full on off, scuffs a drive back to Zampa.

scratchy knock comes to an end with an ungainly hoick. Pressure was building ever so slightly on Shreyas, Zampa floats this one up on a fullish length on middle stump, the batsman goes for an impetuous flick heave across the line and misses badly. Middle stump knocked back. Not a shot you'd be putting in an Instagram story.
stretches forward to a full ball and pushes this tentatively short of extra cover.
flatter and shorter on the stumps at 82 kph, goes back to flick behind square.
glorious! Fullish length ball angled across fourth stump, drives this firmly through extra cover. Races away and puts a charge into the crowd.
short outside off stump, guided past backward point and well wide of deep third man to allow a second.
short of a length on the hips, tries to tuck this into the leg side but can't get it away.
short and wide, slapped off the back foot straight to the cover sweeper.

oof! What a shot! short on fifth stump, ball wasn't really coming onto the bat but Kohli's hands are so good, keeps them back long enough to still have power with the wrists to crack this past extra cover, no chance for the sweeper.
short and wide, tapped into the off side to keep strike for the 35th.
good length ball on the stumps, clipped off the back foot behind square.
flighted very full on off stump, driven firmly to long-off.
full and wide, drives this along the ground to the sweeper.
slightly short drifting into the legs, goes back to clip behind square.
very full on middle, toe-jammed out to long-on. Cursory bat raise to the dressing room and fans for his half-century at a run a ball.
flighted full, defended back to Zampa.
yum yum yum! Fullish length on about fifth stump, but Kohli shuffles back and across to whip this through midwicket.
hummana hummana! Same line and length, this time Kohli stays in his crease and drives it through extra cover.
good length ball on off stump, tries to tap and run, can't get it away.
good length ball on middle stump, taps this straight to midwicket.
fullish length ball on fifth stump, guided to deep third man.
good length ball on off, defended to point. Kohli to be on strike for the next over, nobody complaining in Rajkot.
flighted full on fourth stump, pushed firmly to long-off.
flighted much more on middle and off, tapped gently into the covers.
flatter on fourth stump on a good length, swatted along the ground to long-on.
fullish length on off stump, guided with an open face to the cover sweeper.
quicker and fuller on middle stump, goes back to push down the pitch to Agar.
flighted more on a good length with plenty of width outside off, guided behind point, sweeper has a lot of work to track down and they take two.
short on the legs, tucked off the hips to deep fine leg.
good length ball on middle, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on fifth stump, goes back to punch through cover but the ball keeps very low dribbling through to Carey.
bouncer on the stumps, swatted down through midwicket.
short on the stumps, knocked down to backward point.
short on fourth stump, knocked down just wide of the stumps for a sharp run.
good length ball on off, goes back to punch to the cover sweeper.
good length but width on fifth stump, goes back to cut, beaten by extra bounce.
floated fuller and straying on the legs, gets the front leg out of the way to drive to long-on.
too short, too wide, too sweetly timed a cut shot by Rahul past backward point, cover sweeper is too wide to cut it off.
good length but tighter on off stump, taps this through the covers.
flighted again on a full length on off stump at 81 kph, defended into the off side.
full on the legs, flicked to deep square leg.

missed runout opportunity! Slower ball on off stump guided to Smith at backward point. Rahul took off from the non-striker's end, Smith tried to guide a throw back to Richardson over the stumps instead of firing for a direct hit. Too gentle and allowed Rahul time to get back. Throw was errant too high trying to lob it. Double-whammy.
good length on fifth stump, cut to the sweeper.
good length on fourth stump, goes back to create room to cut to the sweeper.
fullish length on middle, flicked to deep midwicket.
good length on middle, shuffles across to paddle pull fine behind square, super shot and beats the leg side sweeper to the rope.
a bit of flight, flicked to wide long-on. Kohli's still in canter mode
stopped in the pitch a little, and nearly went through Rahul's bat-pad gap
another close call, but the batsman's inside edge gets him off strike

cross-batted slog sweep - what a shot that is! Bottom hand sweep that Kohli somehow managed to keep along the ground without getting down on one knee, and pierces the gap between deep midwicket and long on
worked away for one
back down the ground and Rahul keeps the strike
nudged square on the leg side
good length from Agar. Not allowing Kohli to come down the track or rock back. Takes a single down long-on instead
overpitches it, and pays the price! Full flighted ball, and there's no turn. Rahaul lofts it back over the bowler's head and it cannons into the sightscreen. Gorgeous shot
rocks back and carves it behind third man. 10 off the over already
crunches it down to long-on
dinked into the onside, and the lack of pace means the two can come back for a couple. Excellent batting by India. They appear to be scoring big runs without taking risks
slower ball. No pace to work it, but Rahul smears it down to the sweeper for one
takes the pace off again. Cross-batted down the ground
nearly dragged it onto his stumps. Cannoned into his pads and Rahul frantically searched around for the ball to ensure it didn't trickle onto his stumps
thumped over cover. No timing once more, but plenty of muscle on it
sweetly timed to midwicket. Fielder does well to keep it to one
slower ball, nudged into the offside. Good over from Australia at this stage

he's gone! Zampa's got Kohli again! What a catch that is! Kohli lofted him straight back over his head, looked for all the world it would go for six but for some incredible work on the boundary. Agar takes a clean catch about six inches from the rope, feels himself going over and lobs the ball over to Starc. Incredible coordination for an incredibly big wicket
paddled away to the leg side
brave enough to give it more flight now. Defended to the covers
driven to long-off
chipped to deep midwicket
this one darted through. Thick inside edge and he keeps the strike
top edged from Pandey, no timing on it and Agar completes a much easier catch this time. Was banged in short and Pandey went for the short arm jab, failing to find the middle of the bat
ungainly hoick that's nowhere near the middle. Jadeja on strike
four first delivery. You couldn't ask for a better one to be eased in. Down legside at pace, and all he needed to do was get a feather on it and watch it race away
guided to backward point. Thinks about a run, thinks again
carved to sweeper cover
smart running. Just timed to mid-off and he's on his way
crunched to cover-point. Beautiful timing on it
short delivery, looking to pepper Jadeja, I suspect. He gets off strike
low full toss; this isn't good enough, but KL Rahul most certainly is. Pure timing which beats the man at deep cover-point, and he brings up his 50
is that the shot of the day? I'd venture to say so. Starc at full tilt, and he's lifted him over extra cover for six as if he was Chris Harris on sedatives. Rahul has so much time right now
dragged down. This is a costly over, and 300 is up for India
short ball, helped away to the leg side
sensibly keeps it short once more. But expensive over. Australia would have been counting on Starc, and his next two overs may be crucial to the game's outcome
slower ball again. Jadeja works it away to the onside, and absolutely races back for two. He might have been running quicker than Richardson's bowling right now
smashes it down the ground, runs well clear of the pitch this time
tonked down to cow corner. Rahul is timing the ball so sweetly right now
slower bouncer, nudged away to deep midwicket
runs it down to backward point
clever running once more. Chipped into the vacant space on the legside and Jadeja hares back for two more. 8 off that over
backfoot punch, gorgeous shot again. What can you do about that? Bowling at 145, but Rahul still slices it away past third man for four
run down to third man
full, reverse swinging yorker, but Jadeja smears it down to the onside and scampers back once more
dragged down. Big wide. So big KL Rahul toyed with the idea of coming through for a bye
low full toss, thwacked to deep midwicket
helped down to the fine leg fielder
full toss on leg stump. Very, very fortunate Jadeja's sent this right down to fine leg. That had four written all over it
slower short delivery. Struck to extra cover. They still scamper through
slower bouncer. Rahul turns his bat into a periscope and sort of tennis-smashes it to midwicket. Sharp running by the duo again, they have been superb
full pace, shorter delivery. Rahul swings, but for once, doesn't connect
Cummins has tried to be too clever by half. This short ball Rahul was lying in wait for. Just opened the face of the bat and helped it away over third man all the way for six. Incredible shot.
attempted yorker, but Rahul moved back in his crease, and flicked it to fine leg for four. A diving Labuschagne can't prevent it
keeps the strike for the last over
no timing from the batsman. Went straight up but into a gap.
pull shot gets Rahul back on strike. He's on 80 with 4 balls to go. Any chance of a 100?
misses it completely. Slower ball and a wild hoick that goes through to the keeper. They run a bye Australia aren't too concerned with preventing

and that's Rahul gone. Well done for being so unselfish, to be fair. Went through to the keeper and Rahul as desperate to get back on strike. Carey got the direct hit; a diving Rahul was well out of his crease
yorker. Shami does well to get enough bat on it to get Jadeja on strike
smashed straight to the cover fielder, and they run one. That gets India to 340.
good length ball on off, defended back to Bumrah.
good length ball swinging into the legs, defended tentatively on the back foot back to Bumrah again.
beauty on a good length angled across fifth stump, fishes at this away from his body without any footwork and is beaten.
good length straying on the legs, goes back to tip and run behind square.
fullish length on sixth stump and swinging away, left alone.
good length ball swinging away again, drives at this and is beaten.
full on the legs, flicked through backward square.
fullish length swinging in a touch on fourth stump, firm forward press and this flies off the bat through extra cover. What timing.
short of a length ball on off stump, defended into short mid-off, chased down by Shami.
short on the legs, tapped off the back foot into short midwicket.

short of a length outside off, short arm jab pull over wide mid-on, didn't complete the flourish and it is tracked down by Saini short of the rope. Saini is now clutching his left ankle. He's down for a minute but gets back up now. He's come off for a sub.
short on the stumps, defended into the off side.
short on the legs, flicked behind square to deep fine leg where Kedar Jadhav fields, on as a sub for Saini.
full and swinging down leg big time, Rahul dives left but it keeps on swinging all the way to the rope. 5 freebies to the Aussies.
another hooping inswinger pitches on off on a good length and slams Finch into the pads, missing leg, can't get it away.
no swing this time as the ball holds its line on fifth stump on a fullish length, Finch beaten driving away from his body.
good length ball tailing into fourth stump, prods forward and inside edges into the leg side.
in the slot on sixth stump, square drives this straight to backward point.
gem! Back of a length ball on fourth stump, Finch goes to punch through cover off the back foot, beaten by extra bounce.
short on sixth stump, Warner goes for the full pull shot instead of the short arm jab this time, drags this high over midwicket with a lot of wrist power and it bounces away to the rope.

Pandey! The Barracuda! Length ball angled across fifth stump, Warner spanks this flat toward cover, didn't look like he wanted to keep it down but didn't get the elevation either. Pandey on the ring times his leap perfectly to intercept it with his right hand reaching high over his head. 10/10 from the Swiss, the Russian, the French and the Brazilian judges. Nonchalant flick in the air after the catch before being mobbed by Jadeja and Shreyas. Warner cracks a grin. That was special.
bouncer goes down leg.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
short ball on the stumps, sways back to leave.
good length ball flicked off the pads behind square.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes back to flick across the line through wide mid-on.
full on off, driven to the infield.
good length ball angled into off stump, defended.
good length seams back beating the bat and zips into his thigh guard to carom to slip.
short and wide, cut straight to backward point.
good length on fifth stump angling in, tries to cut but cramped for room, chops it down past off stump into the ground to the keeper.
good length on off, punched off the back foot to extra cover. Maiden for Bumrah.
short on the legs, pulled flat just wide of Rohit at short fine leg. Would've been a stunner had he been able to get a hand to it diving right.
back of a length outside off, floats the bat to chip this behind point, slack fielding at deep third man by Kuldeep to relay in and they alertly take a second.
in the slot on off, shovels this high over extra cover, chased down before the rope by Pandey.

huge lbw shout! This looked very close with Smith shuffling across defending down the wrong line. Given not out. Kohli opts against the review. Was touch and go whether he was hit in line with the stumps, replays show he was hit just outside off
short of a length ball on off, out in front of a pull, hit on the ribs and they pinch a run into short midwicket.
short of a length on off, defended into midwicket.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes back to defend to cover.
fullish length ball, punched not very cleanly to extra cover.
short of a length on the stumps, punched back to the bowler.
good length ball on fifth stump, punched to backward point.
bouncer on off stump, pulls out of the hook shot, one short ball signaled for the over.
good length ball on off, punched off the back foot to extra cover. Bumrah cannot be touched right now. Another maiden.
short on sixth stump, goes to cut and lot of extra bounce takes this past the edge.
good length ball on fourth stump, punched off the back foot to cover.
fullish length ball on off stump, soft hands playing a tap and run into gully.
good length ball at 143 kph on fourth stump, jags in a touch and keeps low to beat Smith's attempted back foot punch.
good length on middle stump, walks across a long way to flick behind square.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes back to punch softly enough toward mid-off to scamper a run.
short of a length on fourth stump, Finch leans back to crunch a square drive behind point. Elegant.
short of a length on off stump, tries to create room to cut but mistimes this into the ground back down the pitch to Shami.
short on the body, garbage ball pulled fine and beats the deep fine leg fielder easily.
back of a length on fourth stump, hops back to punch to mid-off.
good length ball tailing into middle and leg, hops back to clip behind square.
short on the hips, tries to flick behind square but can't get bat on it. Carom goes short enough of short fine leg to allow a tight run.
fullish length on off stump, Smith goes back and across to punch to mid-on.
bread and butter for Smith. Buttah! Fullish length ball on off stump, shuffles well across to flick this through midwicket and it races away.

Bumrah with a matador effort on the deep square leg rope. Full on middle stump, whips this with a touch of Dhoni helicopter behind square, should've been held to one but Bumrah let it go through his imaginary red cape reaching down.
good length ball, defended.
puuuuurrrrrrrfect drive! Full length on off, drives this exquisitely past a vain diving effort at mid-off.
full on fourth stump, whips this firmly but straight to mid-on.
begins with flight outside off stump, expansive drive to deep extra
smartly flicked down the ground
worked away down the ground
happy to milk Jadeja for singles for now
defended into the covers
keeps the strike with one through the covers
full, wicket-to-wicket line. Finch thought about running, but thought better of it
nice line. Doesn't give him enough room to open up the offside - not far away from taking his edge
driven to mid-on and the pair swap ends
big runout chance. Smith bloacked and ran, and a diving Rohit Sharma simply needed to hit the stumps. Suicidal running, gets away with it
short ball, swing and a miss
full and straight, mistimed to mid-on and they scamper through. Eventful over
defended
big appeal, but appeared to hit him outside leg stump and was carrying on with the line
full on leg stump, worked down to long-on
helped down to square leg
driven back to the bowler
eased away to midwicket. Another tight over from India
did the pitch misbehave there? Finch thought it was nicely set up for a cracking square cut, but the ball kept well low
dragged down the onside, gets a tickle on the pad. Kohli thought there was an edge; there wasn't
blocks and runs. Finch isn't quite finding the timing at the moment
short and wide, Smith moves across and leans into it to nudge the ball to third man
a gimme ball that Finch gratefully accepts. Pace onto his pad, allowing Finch to hop across and put it away behind square leg. Big pressure reliever, that
prods it into the onside and hares back for two. Could Finch finally be on his way to a big score?
starts off with a loosener outside leg, which Smith easily guides to square leg
paddled away to fine leg. Smith is continuing to find ways of keeping the asking rate in check
wrong-un. Finch didn't seem to pick it, and went for a sweep that would have made more sense with the turn. Beaten, but has his foot planted, so the stumping isn't a threat
heaveed over to cow corner. No real timing, but gets two
helped to the onside
another wrong-un, Smith lobs this into the air with the turn. The in-fielder on the offside thought he was in with a chance but it's well out of his grasp. Eight off that over

have they got their man? Yes, they have! Finch opened his body up to smash it over extra cover, but was beaten by the turn. Excellent glovework by KL Rahul, who whips the bails off while Finch's foot is on the line. Incredibly tight call, but I think giving it out is the right one. Dhoni would have been proud of that
turn and flight, drives it down to long-off
same shot, different batsman
guides it down to long-off
nearly a catch, that! The ball stopped and flew up in the air, agonisingly out of the reach of a valiantly diving Jadeja.
sliced to cover. Successful over for India
nicely flighted, opens the face of the bat to guide it to backward point
helps it to midwicket
another wrong-un, but slightly short and Smith has enough time to rock back and ease it to the onside
shap fielding from Virat, a dive prevents the single
he's on his way! Mid-off was in the circle, and Kuldeep bowled a wrong-un, but he takes it on anyway and smashes him over the fielder
paddled down to fine leg. Could Labuschagne, in his first ODI, be the man who guides Australia home? That's me getting carried away
worked away to the onside
sliced to backward point and the two scamper back for a couple
sloppy fielding. Good delivery, but of flight and turn, but the bowler and mid-off get into a bit of a tangle, presenting the opportunity to steal a run
brilliant shot. Rocks back and punches it to the left of extra cover, and it's placed nicely enough to evade a diving sweeper cover
runs it down to long-on
stayed slightly low. 9 off the over. Australia clawing back a bit of momentum
short of a length, worked comfortably away for one
hunches low, and sweeps it to square leg
flight, and stopped on the batsman slightly
another wrong'un, but starts it outside leg stump. Flicked down to fine leg
cross batted shot down to off stumo
How good is that shot? Pretty darn good, I'd say. Picks the line and length early, moves across, and absolutely bludgeons a slog-sweep for four. This is a nice little spell for Australia
opens the face of the blade and eases it to third man. The pace is back because these two looked so settled against spin
short of a length, moves across and nurdles it to fine leg
uses the pace of the bowler to work it to third man. Wasn't middled, but had enough on it to go through to Kuldeep on the bounce
comfortably flicked down to the onside
run down to third man once more
thick outside edge, might have been deliberate, and it beats Kuldeep at third man! Nine from that over.
flighted full on the legs, paddle sweep to deep fine leg for a sharply run two.
flighted onto off stump, misses a sweep and is struck on the pads but ball didn't straighten, would've carried past off stump. LBW shout denied.
flighted full on fifth stump, driven to long-off.
full on middle, whipped to deep square leg.
good length ball on the legs, clipped behind square.
flighted on a fullish length on middle and off, goes very deep in the crease to flick behind square. 50 up for Smith off just 47 balls.
short on off stump, pulls this off somewhat of a top edge toward deep square leg but falls well short.
fullish length on off stump, punched straight to extra cover.
good length on the stumps, flicked behind square.
full on the stumps, flicked straight to midwicket.
bouncer high outside off, called wide. Spoiled for choice, could've been given on line or height.
full on fourth stump, shuffles back and across to flick through to deep midwicket.
good length ball on off at 121 kph, flicked through square leg.
flighted on a good length on middle, backs away to punch straight back to Kuldeep.
flighted on a fullish length on fourth stump, goes back to punch but straight to cover.
flighted very full on fourth stump, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
flighted on a good length on middle and leg, premeditates a paddle scoop over Rahul, not timed well and goes just outside the ring for two.
flighted full on fourth stump, slog sweep through midwicket and screams along the ground through wide long-on. Super shot.
drags the length back and gives it more air landing on a good length on fourth stump, backs away to drive against the turn but is beaten by a touch of extra bounce.
good length ball on the stumps, tap and run through point.
good length ball on fourth stump, opens the face to guide to deep third man.
good length on middle and leg, clipped off the back foot behind square.
attempted yorker on middle, dug out to square leg.
short and wide way outside off, gets on his toes to slap this straight to the cover sweeper.
fullish length on the legs, clipped to deep midwicket.
full on middle, driven to long-on.
full on middle and driven back to Jadeja.
flighted more and dragged wider on fifth stump, beaten driving.
good length on middle, goes back to flick past short fine leg, enough pace off the ball from Jadeja at 97 kph to just use it and work it behind square for a smart boundary.
good length ball defended to point.
short of a length on the legs, tapped behind square.
full on the stumps, driven to mid-on. Shami throws into the striker's stumps but the ricochet doesn't go wide enough for an overthrow.
good length ball defended to point.
good length ball defended into the covers.
good length ball jags back down leg, Smith shuffled a long way across and missed a flick. No wide called as it just missed leg stump, actually looked like it went over the top.
short of a length on fifth stump, punched off the back foot through cover.
fullish length on off, defended to mid-on.
flighted full on off, whipped straight to midwicket.
full and wide, driven square to backward point.
flighted a touch more at 89 kph on fourth stump very full, driven to extra cover.
flatter on middle and drags the length back at 94 kph, Smith goes across to flick through square leg.
flat and full on leg stump at 92 kph, backs away but punches straight to mid-off.

overpitched with more air at 89 kph and dragged wide on sixth stump, plenty of width for Labuschagne to drive aerially over extra cover, long-off has no chance running across. Spectacular shot. Shades of KL Rahul's six in the first innings.
short of a length on off, punched through cover.
good length on fourth stump, guided behind point.
good length on fifth stump, wristily flicked behind square.
overpitched on middle, just a nonchalant punch on the front foot and it races back down the pitch, beats mid-on with ease.
fullish length on middle and off, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on off, defended to extra cover.
short outside off, punched through to the cover sweeper.
short of a length on off stump, punched to long-on.

stone dead! Has to be! Given not out! Kohli calls for the review. Smith did his traditional back and across but missed in front of middle stump halfway up just above the knee roll but very deep in his crease. DRS ball-tracking shows... Umpire's call clipping the leg bails! Extremely brave from umpire Kettleborough to give that not out on field.
full on middle, driven to long-on.
uses his feet to drive a full ball in the air wide of Smith at the non-striker's end to long-on.
full on the stumps, driven to long-on.
good length wide outside off, guided to deep third man.
good length ball on off, driven wide of extra cover, diving stop but they still take a run.
short and wide outside off, driven to the sweeper.
good length on fourth stump, punched square to backward point.
good length on middle and off, punched to backward point again.
bouncer, beats the attempted hook. Good ball, but can't dislodge Labuschagne.
dances down the track and gets off strike
no timing, that was uppish, just out of Jadeja's reach. It goes all the way for four, though, and you can hear a pin drop
better ball, pushes Smith back, but he manages to work it away for a run

and that's the wicket! Rajkot erupts! He is furious with himself! Came down the track but seemed caught in two minds as regards to whether he should chip it or look to clear the mid-off fielder. Ends up as the most comfortable catch for Mohammad Shami. Huge, huge scalp
defends first up. Big, big over for India
helps it down to fine leg. Smith looking to carry on as if nothing has happened
Reverse sweeps Kuldeep first up. Lacked conviction, though, and it produces no runs
now the regular sweep, and a misfield at short fine leg gets him off the mark
driven back to the bowler
nearly lost balance there. Thought about sweeping, realised it was too full, and nearly fell over getting the ball away to square leg
nice drive. Four off the Kuldeep over, and the asking rate begins to rise once more
another reverse sweep, but a diving Chahal prevents three. Excellent fielding
uppishly played back to Jadeja
dragged down legside
opens the face of the bat to the covers
rocks back and flicks to fine leg, where they steal a single
a third reverse sweep from Carey. So far, it hasn't really produced results
single down to long-on
flighted nicely, and Carey finally decides to play a conventional shot down to long-off
comes down the ground but the outcome doesn't quite match the aggressive intent
wrong'un. Carey had no idea about it, nearly found himself trapped plumb in front
that's what Carey should be doing more. Gets down low and smears it over cow corner. Not middled, but it still comfortably sails over the rope and into the stands
beats the man in the in-field, but decent work from Saini on the boundary prevents the four
long hop that Smith works to midwicket. 13 off the over. That should help with the rising asking rate
carved to point, and it brings up the 200
uses his feet and sends it back down to long-on
the glance keeps the scoreboard ticking over
length pulled back, Smith sends it to a fielder
makes up for it, and then some! Who said Smith doesn't have power hitting ability. Right from the middle and it goes 90 METRES into the stands
and keeps the strike. A couple of excellent overs for Australia. Runs coming without too many risks
defended
big, big appeal as Smith tried to smear Kuldeep onto the onside. Never looked out, though
dances down the ground and it goes through to long-on on the bounce
cut away on the back foot
wrong'un, well read and the pair smartly come through for a single
kept low. Tight over from Kuldeep, just the three off it
begins with a length delivery, flicked to midwicket
back of a length, rushes Carey even though it was just 133 kph
excellent placement. Ever so slightly wide off off, and he leaps on to it, beats backward point, and there's nothing third man can do about it. Smith moves to 96
defended back to the bowler
beaten by the bounce. Went under the bat, doubled Smith over slightly
the bounce beats him again. Thick inside edge. Saini's rescued the over somewhat after the boundary
eased onto the onside. 2 runs away now
the softest of dismissals, and Rajkot breathes again. Checked his shot instead of going through with it, and it goes straight to extra cover for the simplest catch. 100 wickets for Kuldeep Yadav
off the mark with a backfoot punch
beats him with the googly. Another tight over, this

what an over this is! Smith falls two runs shy of a 100! Nothing in the delivery, really, but Smith plays on. Kuldeep is making a difference after an indifferent day up to this over. Is this the game?
blocked. Match-turning over, surely
worked to square leg. With Bumrah, India looking for the killer blow
slower ball, Agar doesn't know much about it
thick outside edge. Another slower delivery, and it goes through to Rahul on the bounce
nicely timed down the ground
legbyes for four. Much, much needed for Australia. Slightly misdirected from Bumrah for once, and it beats the man at fine leg
sharp running. Turner keeps the strike as the asking rate moves above 10
muscled away to the on-side for a couple. Turner needs to have a go soon.
huge appeal from India. Full delivery that struck Turner on the toe, but umpire unconvinced. India review It's missing leg stump. Australia still retain that glimmer of hope
aggressive bouncer, Agar gets out of the way
drags it down the on side
swiped down to cow corner. Gets Turner back on strike. The required rate has climbed to 10.5
well bowled. Full ball defended straight back to Shami
they scamper back for two, taking on the long-on fielder. 7 off that over, and here's Peter to take you to the finish

good length ball angled across fourth stump, Agar just dabs this with the angle toward Saini at deep third man, didn't have far to go to cut this off but Saini looking gimpy all night on that left ankle and it beats him easily.
good length on fourth stumps, defended.
middle stump yorker, toe-jammed out wide of the keeper and they scamper a run. Great ball, well played.
yorker on fourth stump, jammed out to point.
slower ball at 118 kph on a good length outside off, cut through the off side.
another attempted yorker lands very full on middle stump, jammed out back to Bumrah stumbling forward in his follow-through.
flighted full on fourth stump, driven to long-off.
good length on fifth stump, tries to flick this across the line, beaten.
short ball on sixth stump, flat bats this down the ground nearly taking out Turner at the non-striker's end. Goes to long-on.
short on off, cut to Saini who is now at backward point.
lands slightly short on off, goes back to flick through midwicket.

slog sweep to a full ball goes off a top-edge sky high toward deep backward square. Chahal on as a sub for Dhawan most of the innings runs in from the boundary but grows alligator arms as the ball hurtles back toward earth. It lands three yards in front of him. Never looked remotely interested in diving.
bouncer on the stumps, poorly directed and Agar swivels to hook this through vacant deep backward square.

short and wide, cut hard to deep point, Rohit runs across and puts in a dive to cut this off, looks like he may have injured his left shoulder. He's writhing around in pain clutching vigorously. His body was in contact with the rope as he slid to stop it. Looks grim. He's off the field.
shin height full toss on fourth stumps, guided behind point and they scamper two.
yorker on middle and off, jammed back down the pitch and cut off by mid-off.
leg stump yorker dug out to square leg.
leg stump yorker again, jammed out back to Saini.

steady diet of yorkers and this is one too many for Turner to digest! This one is dialed in on middle stump, Turner premeditated backing away to drive over cover and swings over the top of this. Great bowling.
action replay of the previous ball! Another middle stump yorker, Cummins can't keep this out trying to stab at it defensively. Shami is on a hat-trick.
nearly! Another yorker, this time heading for leg stump, Starc plays around it, huge appeal but looked like it was trailing down leg. Given not out and they scamper a pair of leg byes.
short ball, goes to hook, beaten.
another attempted yorker but sprayed down leg to the lefty.
slower ball on fourth stump, defended to extra cover.
another leg stump yorker, misses another flick. Given not out and they hustle another extra.
good length ball on the stumps, driven out to long-on.
yorker just misses leg stump with Starc backing away.
full on middle stump, driven to long-on.
off stump yorker, scuffs a drive to long-on.
another middle stump yorker, jammed out to deep midwicket.
leg stump yorker, jammed out to point.
yorker on middle, jammed out to long-on.
knee high full toss on leg stump, rare misfire on another attempted yorker but Agar can only manage to get this out to long-on for one.
off stump yorker, stabbed out behind point.
yorker on off stump, scuffed out to mid-off.
full length on off stump, drives this firmly to long-on.
off stump yorker, glided out to deep point.

yorker on middle stump, traps Agar stone dead in front struck low on the shin. Given out but he's reviewed this in desperation. And sure enough it's three reds. Impact just in line with off stump, but he was deep in the crease, it was ripping out middle.
rare error in this spell from Saini, misfires a knee high full toss on off stump, but only slapped straight down the ground.
bouncer, goes to hook, appeal and given out. Surprise ball after about four overs in a row of yorkers and a thin top edge is easily taken by Rahul, who has looked superb behind the stumps all day.
full on leg stump, backs away to drive to mid-on.
short and wide, backs away to carve an elegant cut high over backward point. Cosmetic correction to the scorecard.
yorker follows Zampa backing away from leg stump, fought off back to Saini.
yorker on off stump, jammed out to extra cover.
length ball on middle stump, slapped down the pitch and cut off by mid-on.
yorker on fourth stump, glided out to deep third man.
yorker on off stump, jammed out into the off side.
length ball in the slot on leg stump, backs away and hammers this back over Zampa at the non-striker's end and races to the rope, beating long-on Pandey.
short ball follows Richardson backing away, looked like he was pinged on the helmet ducking through a pull, ball ricochets back short of Bumrah.
full ball on middle, driven to extra cover, diving stop by Kuldeep but they take a run.
yorker on middle, dug out back to Shami.
length ball follows Richardson backing away from leg, he heaves this through midwicket, beats long-on to the rope.
ankle high full toss on leg stump, yorker length just misses and Richardson shovels this high over umpire Kettleborough into the rope.
length ball on off stump, Richardson clobbers this high and deep over mid-off. 300 up for Australia, but it's cosmetic with the game just about over.
another length ball on off, clocked clean and flat over mid-off, bounces over the rope. Impressive late flurry by Richardson to pad his stats.

back of a length ball follows Zampa backing away from leg stump, tries to fend this off but only manages an edge through to Rahul. Bumrah finally gets a much deserved wicket. That's it. India win by 36 runs.
